content: Savings Bank Account Asked by AnonymousAsked on 10 Jun 2019Should I stick with FRANK or go with 360?The scenario:10k in OCBC FRANKonly about $200 increment per monthCurrently receive about $3 from the 0.3% i/r from FRANK. The i/r calculator for 360 shows >$1 monthly.5 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Ng, Economics at Singapore Management UniversityLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 10 Jun 2019I have an OCBC Frank account but I do not park my savings there as the interest is rather minimal! I choose to put them in CIMB Fastsaver that gives me 1% without any conditions attached.I did not look at OCBC 360 or DBS Multiplier as I'm unable to fulfill the criterias for higher interest rates.0 comments4

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 10 Jun 2019OCBC 360 for The win !Aside to that I think you should also look at the other accounts out there using the Seedly calculator to judge if there might be a better one based on your lifestyle2 comments2
Question Poster10 Jun 2019Thanks!Kenneth Lou10 Jun 2019Yeah same agreed with Jeff! OCBC 360 all day long, if you are a working adult with salary crediting

T@Takingstock @Level 5. GeniusAnswered on 11 Jun 2019Personally I have a Frank and a 360 account.My salary and all of my giro deductions go against the 360 account (my treasury account).I transfer my monthly allowance to Frank account (my spending account)For 10k balance, if you meet the salary crediting criteria, 360 would be kinda worth it....But honestly, if you do not see an urgent need for the money, I think you are slightly better off putting like 5k in SSB to get 2% yield on non-urgent monies you are keeping as a reserve.0 comments1

Ronald SzieLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 10 Jun 2019You must see if you can fulfil the criteria on OCBC 360 account. It can be quite difficult if your lifestyle does not meet the account requirements. I hope you don't change your spending/investments just to earn that 0.5% interest. Do see your regular usage pattern and see if the account suits. You can always switch to other banks if there are no products in OCBC that suits you.0 comments1

Vincent Tan Wen BinLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 11 Jun 2019I would go with 360 if you are able to fulfill the criterias for their interest. The interest return is pretty good, as with multiplier dbs and uob one account. But just start somewhere and start looking for more investments to add into your portfolio to create passive income stream.2 comments1

Question Poster10 Jun 2019The interest rate calculator shows monthly payout is lower though?Vincent Tan Wen Bin11 Jun 2019If you are able to fulfil the criterias in 360, the return should be higher than the Frank account.
